requirement_tested: Frontend application with pages for property listings, property details, and search/filter interface
user_persona: A first-time visitor interested in browsing homes for sale.
user_goal: Navigate between different sections of the website to explore property listings, view detailed information, and use search/filter tools.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the real estate website and sees a clean homepage with a navigation menu at the top.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Homepage loads successfully with a fixed header showing logo on the left and navigation links (Home, Listings, Saved Properties, Contact Us) on the right. Background is alice blue with steel blue text.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Property Listings
narrative_steps.description: Curious about available properties, Sarah scrolls down to see a grid of property cards displayed below the search/filter bar.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid of property cards loads automatically, each showing an image thumbnail, address, price, bedrooms/bathrooms, and square footage. All elements are styled with steel blue on alice blue background.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Property Details
narrative_steps.description: One listing catches her eye, so she clicks on the card to learn more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a property card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: User is redirected to the property detail page which displays a carousel of images, full address, price, description, features, and map.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Functionality
narrative_steps.description: Returning to the listings page, Sarah decides to look for something specific using the search bar.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'downtown' into the search input field and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The property list updates to show only those matching the term 'downtown', maintaining consistent styling.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: She then refines results further by setting filters such as price range and bedroom count.
narrative_steps.action: Adjust the price slider to $300k–$500k, select '3' from the Bedrooms dropdown, and click the 'Search' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results update instantly to reflect filtered criteria. No layout issues or broken styles appear.

requirement_tested: Backend API server exposing endpoints for property data retrieval and search functionality
user_persona: A developer testing integration points for frontend components.
user_goal: Verify that backend endpoints return correct data formats and respond properly to requests.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Property Listings
narrative_steps.description: The developer sends a GET request to retrieve initial batch of property summaries.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/properties endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server responds with JSON array containing property objects including id, title, price, address, bedrooms, bathrooms, sqft, and image URL.

narrative_steps.title: Retrieving Individual Property Details
narrative_steps.description: Next, they query for a specific property's extended information.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/properties/123 where 123 is a valid ID.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Response includes full property details like description, latitude/longitude, and additional metadata in structured format.

narrative_steps.title: Searching Properties by Keyword
narrative_steps.description: Developer simulates user searching by sending a keyword query.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/search?query=luxury.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns subset of properties whose titles or descriptions match the word 'luxury'.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Based on Multiple Criteria
narrative_steps.description: They now test advanced filtering options.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to /api/filter with body { price_min: 200000, bedrooms: 4 }.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receives filtered list of properties meeting specified conditions without errors.

requirement_tested: Database connection to PostgreSQL using environment variables: DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, DB_NAME
user_persona: System administrator deploying the backend service.
user_goal: Confirm that backend connects securely to PostgreSQL database using configured environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Environment Variables
narrative_steps.description: Admin configures the deployment environment with exact values for database connectivity.
narrative_steps.action: Set environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Environment variables are set correctly within the runtime context.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: With environment ready, admin starts the backend server process.
narrative_steps.action: Run npm run dev command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend initializes successfully and establishes secure connection to PostgreSQL instance using provided credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Querying Database Through API
narrative_steps.description: Admin verifies data flow from database through API by making sample requests.
narrative_steps.action: Make GET request to /api/properties.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Data returned matches what exists in the connected PostgreSQL 'properties' table.

requirement_tested: Property listing page displaying multiple property summaries with key details
user_persona: Casual home buyer looking for inspiration.
user_goal: Browse through several attractive property previews quickly.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Listings Page
narrative_steps.description: Emily visits the site and lands directly on the listings page via direct link.
narrative_steps.action: Visit /listings route.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page renders a responsive grid of property summary cards, styled with alice blue background and steel blue accents.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Card Content
narrative_steps.description: She scans the cards and checks if essential info is visible at a glance.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect visual presentation of one property card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each card clearly shows image thumbnail, address, price, bedrooms/bathrooms, and square footage with no overlapping or missing data.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Infinite Scroll
narrative_steps.description: After viewing initial set, Emily scrolls down to load more listings.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll towards bottom of page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional property cards load smoothly without breaking layout or causing errors.

requirement_tested: Property detail page showing comprehensive information for individual properties
user_persona: Interested buyer evaluating a particular house.
user_goal: Review all important aspects of a selected property before deciding next steps.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Property Detail View
narrative_steps.description: John clicks on a promising listing from the main page.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a property card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to property-specific detail page with unique URL reflecting property ID.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Full Description and Features
narrative_steps.description: He reads through the detailed description and notes key stats.
narrative_steps.action: Scan the textual content and structured feature blocks.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All fields—address, price, description, beds/baths/sqft—are populated accurately and presented cleanly with consistent theming.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Image Carousel
narrative_steps.description: Wanting better visuals, John navigates through photos using arrows.
narrative_steps.action: Click forward/backward navigation arrows in the image carousel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Images transition smoothly; active indicator reflects current position in sequence.

requirement_tested: Search functionality allowing users to find properties by keywords or specific criteria
user_persona: Busy professional seeking targeted housing options.
user_goal: Quickly locate suitable properties using precise search terms.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Search Term
narrative_steps.description: Lisa knows exactly what neighborhood she wants and types it into the search box.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Maple Street' into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Input field accepts typed characters and displays placeholder/example text when empty.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Search Query
narrative_steps.description: She submits the search either by pressing Enter or clicking the button.
narrative_steps.action: Press Enter key OR click 'Search' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Property listings refresh immediately to show only those matching 'Maple Street'; previous filters reset unless preserved explicitly.

requirement_tested: Filtering capability to narrow down property listings by attributes such as price range, location, property type, bedrooms, bathrooms, and square footage
user_persona: First-time homebuyer with very specific preferences.
user_goal: Find ideal homes within budget and preferred specifications.

narrative_steps.title: Adjusting Price Range Slider
narrative_steps.description: Mike sets his maximum affordable price using the slider control.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the upper handle of the price slider to $450,000.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Slider visually updates and numerical value reflects new limit. Listings adjust accordingly after applying filters.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Property Type
narrative_steps.description: He narrows focus to single-family homes only.
narrative_steps.action: Choose 'Single Family Home' from the property type dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dropdown selection highlights choice and remains visible until changed. Results update upon submission.

narrative_steps.title: Combining Filters
narrative_steps.description: Mike combines multiple selections to refine his search even more.
narrative_steps.action: Select '4 Bedrooms', '2+ Bathrooms', and move square footage slider to min 2000 sqft.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multiple filters work together seamlessly, updating results to match combined constraints without conflicts.

requirement_tested: Responsive design ensuring usability across desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: Mobile user exploring properties during commute.
user_goal: Use the website effectively despite limited screen space.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Site on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Anna opens the site on her smartphone while commuting.
narrative_steps.action: Open homepage on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Site adapts layout for smaller viewport — stacked cards, collapsible navigation menu, larger touch targets, readable font sizes.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Touch Controls
narrative_steps.description: She taps around to navigate and interact with elements.
narrative_steps.action: Tap on property cards, search bar, and filter buttons.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Elements respond promptly to taps; no accidental triggers or unresponsive areas.

narrative_steps.title: Rotating Screen Orientation
narrative_steps.description: Switches orientation to landscape mode mid-browsing.
narrative_steps.action: Rotate device from portrait to landscape.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout reflows appropriately, maintaining readability and accessibility regardless of orientation.

requirement_tested: Consistent styling with alice blue background color and steel blue applied to all UI elements
user_goal: Ensure all UI components align with specified color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Global Colors
narrative_steps.description: Marketing lead reviews the overall aesthetic of the site.
narrative_steps.action: Load any page and inspect CSS applied to major containers and text elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background consistently uses alice blue (#F0F8FF); all borders, icons, and text utilize steel blue (#4682B4).

narrative_steps.title: Checking Interactive Components
narrative_steps.description: Looks closely at buttons, inputs, and hover effects.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over interactive elements like buttons and form fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Hover states maintain steel blue theme without introducing conflicting colors or gradients.

requirement_tested: Navigation menu enabling seamless movement between main sections of the website
user_persona: Regular user navigating frequently used paths.
user_goal: Move efficiently between core sections without confusion.

narrative_steps.title: Using Top-Level Navigation
narrative_steps.description: Robert wants to switch from browsing listings to checking saved items.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Saved Properties' link in the header navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: User is taken to the Saved Properties section without reloading entire app shell unnecessarily.

narrative_steps.title: Returning to Homepage
narrative_steps.description: After exploring, he returns to the starting point.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Home' link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirects smoothly back to homepage with latest listings still visible and properly rendered.

requirement_tested: Pagination or infinite scrolling mechanism for browsing large sets of property listings
user_persona: Power user scanning many listings extensively.
user_goal: Effortlessly browse hundreds of properties without manual pagination.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Load of Listings
narrative_steps.description: Emma lands on the listings page and views first batch.
narrative_steps.action: Visit listings page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: First group of property cards loads quickly with clear indication of continuation (spinner or scroll trigger).

narrative_steps.title: Auto-Loading More Results
narrative_steps.description: As she scrolls, more listings appear automatically.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll near the bottom of the loaded content.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New batch of property cards loads seamlessly, appending beneath existing ones without disrupting scroll position.

requirement_tested: Interactive map component displaying property locations (if geospatial data is available)
user_goal: Explore nearby properties using geographical visualization.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Map on Property Detail Page
narrative_steps.description: Carlos reaches the detail page and notices an integrated map.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the map section below property details.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Interactive Leaflet-based map appears centered on the property’s coordinates, with surrounding markers indicating other listings.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Nearby Markers
narrative_steps.description: Intrigued by neighboring homes, he interacts with nearby pins.
narrative_steps.action: Click a marker on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Popup bubble shows brief property info and a clickable link leading to that property’s detail page.

requirement_tested: User session management for potential future features like favorites or saved searches
user_goal: Maintain logged-in state across sessions for accessing saved content.

narrative_steps.title: Simulating Login Flow
narrative_steps.description: Test engineer mocks successful authentication and observes session behavior.
narrative_steps.action: Mock JWT token storage in localStorage after simulated login.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Token persists across tabs/windows and is accessible to authenticated routes requiring session data.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Session Persistence
narrative_steps.description: Reloads the browser to confirm persistence.
narrative_steps.action: Refresh the page after storing session token.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Session remains active and protected routes remain accessible without redirecting to login prompt.

requirement_tested: Loading states and error handling for API requests and data fetching operations
user_goal: Receive feedback when data fails to load and ability to retry.

narrative_steps.title: Encountering Slow Network
narrative_steps.description: While waiting for data, Maria observes how the interface handles delays.
narrative_steps.action: Simulate slow internet speed or delayed API response.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Loading spinner animation appears prominently in center of content area until data resolves or times out.

narrative_steps.title: Handling Request Failure
narrative_steps.description: Eventually, the request fails due to timeout or server issue.
narrative_steps.action: Force API endpoint to return 500 Internal Server Error.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Error message replaces loading spinner: 'Failed to load content. Please try again later.', styled with steel blue text on alice blue background.

narrative_steps.title: Retrying Failed Requests
narrative_steps.description: Maria attempts to recover by retrying the operation.
narrative_steps.action: Click the retry button shown alongside the error message.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Request re-submitted and, assuming success this time, actual content populates normally.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with scripts: install:all to setup both frontend and backend dependencies, dev to start both servers concurrently
user_persona: New contributor joining the project team.
user_goal: Easily get started with local development environment.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Fresh clone requires installing packages for both parts of the stack.
narrative_steps.action: Run npm run install:all from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend node_modules folders are created, and all declared dependencies installed without conflicts.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Once setup completes, developer starts both services locally.
narrative_steps.action: Execute npm run dev command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently utility launches both frontend dev server (typically React/Vue) and backend API server (Node/Express), logging outputs separately but synchronously.
